Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram

Class ClassDiagramRelationsManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.ClassDiagramRelationsManager
Direct Known Subclasses:
AggregationManager, AssociationManager, CompositionManager, InheritanceManager
public abstract class ClassDiagramRelationsManager extends Object

Class Diagram Relations Manager

The ClassDiagramRelationsManager is responsible for managing the relationships between classes in a UML diagram. This class provides methods to enable or disable various relationship modes, such as association, aggregation, composition, and inheritance. It also provides utility methods to calculate the distance between class boundaries and to position labels related to these relationships (such as multiplicity and association labels).

Each relationship type (association, aggregation, composition, inheritance) is controlled by a flag, and the appropriate relationship can be drawn by calling the createRelationship(javafx.scene.layout.VBox, javafx.scene.layout.VBox, javafx.scene.layout.Pane, java.lang.String, java.lang.String, java.lang.String) method, which is abstract and needs to be implemented by subclasses.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-04

    • enableAssociationMode

      public void enableAssociationMode()
      Enables the association relationship mode.

      This method sets enabledAssociationModel to true, allowing the creation of association relationships between classes.

    • disableAssociationMode

      public void disableAssociationMode()
      Disables the association relationship mode.

      This method sets enabledAssociationModel to false, disabling the creation of association relationships between classes.

    • createRelationship

      public abstract void createRelationship(javafx.scene.layout.VBox start, javafx.scene.layout.VBox end, javafx.scene.layout.Pane drawingPane, String relationshipName, String startMultiplicity, String endMultiplicity)
      Abstract method to create a relationship between two classes.

      This method must be implemented by a subclass to create a specific type of relationship (association, aggregation, composition, or inheritance) between two classes represented by start and end.

      Parameters:
      start - The starting class (VBox) for the relationship.
      end - The ending class (VBox) for the relationship.
      drawingPane - The pane where the relationship will be drawn.
      relationshipName - The name of the relationship (e.g., "association", "aggregation").
      startMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the start of the relationship (e.g., "1", "0..*").
      endMultiplicity - The multiplicity at the end of the relationship (e.g., "1", "0..*").

    • getClosestBoundaryPoint

      public ClassDiagramRelationsManager.Point getClosestBoundaryPoint(javafx.scene.layout.VBox startClass, javafx.scene.layout.VBox endClass)
      Finds the closest boundary point between two classes (VBox).

      This method calculates the closest points on the boundaries of two classes (represented as VBox) and returns the point on the starting class that is closest to the boundary of the ending class. This is useful for positioning relationships between classes.

      Parameters:
      startClass - The starting class (VBox).
      endClass - The ending class (VBox).
      Returns:
      The closest boundary point from the start class.

    • getBoundaryPoints

      public ClassDiagramRelationsManager.Point[] getBoundaryPoints(javafx.scene.layout.VBox classBox)
      Gets the four boundary points of a class (represented as a VBox).

      This method returns the four boundary points (top, right, bottom, left) for a given class (VBox), which are used for positioning relationships between classes.

      Parameters:
      classBox - The class (VBox) for which boundary points are needed.
      Returns:
      An array of Point objects representing the boundary points.

    • calculateDistance

      public double calculateDistance(ClassDiagramRelationsManager.Point p1, ClassDiagramRelationsManager.Point p2)
      Calculates the Euclidean distance between two points.

      This method calculates the straight-line distance between two points (p1 and p2) in 2D space using the Euclidean distance formula.

      Parameters:
      p1 - The first point.
      p2 - The second point.
      Returns:
      The Euclidean distance between the two points.

    • bindAssociationLabelToLine

      public void bindAssociationLabelToLine(javafx.scene.text.Text label, javafx.scene.shape.Line line)
      Binds a label to the midpoint of a relationship line.

      This method binds the position of a label (e.g., association label) to the midpoint of a relationship line. The label will move dynamically as the line is adjusted.

      Parameters:
      label - The label to bind.
      line - The relationship line to bind the label to.

    • bindMultiplicityLabelToLine

      public void bindMultiplicityLabelToLine(javafx.scene.text.Text label, javafx.scene.shape.Line line, boolean isStart)
      Binds a multiplicity label to one end of the relationship line.

      This method binds the position of a multiplicity label (e.g., "1", "0..*") to one of the ends of the relationship line, depending on whether it is the start or end of the relationship.

      Parameters:
      label - The label to bind.
      line - The relationship line to bind the label to.
      isStart - True if the label is for the start of the relationship, false for the end.
